intro: Scaphyglottis subulata, commonly known as the needleleaf scaphyglottis, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Scaphyglottis subulata is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
